job.title: Data Scientist
job.description:
Below is the Job Details:
Title: Data Scientist, Associate
Location: Thousand Oaks, CA (Remote – Need to visit site whenever needed)
Contract: 13+ months (with possible extension)

Comments:
• Flexible commuter, local candidates are highly preferred in case they need to go onsite.
• Some Pharma/Healthcare industry experience is a huge plus.
• Must have Databricks and Smartsheet.
Description:
• This ideal candidate will be responsible for providing support to advance artificial intelligence and data analytics efforts by building machine learning models and supporting their implementation and deployment through collaborations with stakeholders.
Responsibilities include:
• Build machine learning models through integration of multiple data sources
• Leverage large datasets to conduct end-to end analytics that include data gathering and requirements specifications, processing, analytics, and presentations
• Interact cross-functionally with a wide variety of people and teams.
• Work closely with subject matter experts to deliver value by developing novel, practical, scientific data-driven solutions to meet business needs
Basic Qualifications:
• Bachelor’s degree (mathematics, computer science, engineering, or other quantitative discipline)
Preferred Qualifications:
• Knowledge of comprehensive set of data analytics and modeling methods, such as unsupervised (i.e. PCA, K-Means), supervised (i.e. PLS, tree-based algorithms and deep learning) approaches, and in their application to biotechnology processes
• Familiarity working with large data sets, data mining and machine learning tools
• Familiarity with various artificial intelligence applications
• Proficiency in Python and SQL Programming Languages
• Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
• Independent, self-motivated, organized, able to multi-task in project environments, and skilled in communication, facilitation, and collaboration.
• Team player, prepared to work in and embrace a team-based culture that relies on collaboration for effective decision-making
• Familiarity with DevOps and good software practices (i.e. version control, continuous integration, test driven development)
